abstract: Researchers at Tel Aviv University publish study in journal PLoS One finding that farming may have originated 23,000 years ago; study contradicts commonly held belief that agriculture began only about 12,000 years ago, in region that now includes Iraq and parts of Turkey and Iran.
lead_paragraph: Farming may have originated 23,000 years ago, thousands of years earlier than previously thought, according to seeds researchers found at an ancient site.

headline.main: Farming Had an Earlier Start, a Study Says
headline.print_headline: Agriculture: Farming Had an Earlier Start, a Study Says

snippet: Farming may have originated 23,000 years ago, thousands of years earlier than previously thought, according to seeds researchers found at an ancient site.
